I guess if you grew up near Detroit I can see this place's appeal but there are plenty of other dog joints in Phoenix that do it better, this place isn't even the best dog in Tempe. Stick to Ted's or Dave's or even Lobby's if you like Chicago style.

65aJimCmYlKCRfIbvEOZKQ.text: I always either have a friend bring me  a brick of chili or I buy it when I visit  Michigan. I love coneys.  I enjoyed going to the DCG.  The owner made it a fun place to visit.  Had a Vernors which was great and two coney dogs.  I downgraded them only because the coneys were in a basket and not on a plate.  By the end of eating the second dog I was eating the plastic paper.  Please get plates and silverware.

f3OnjYP9kvhNyr7Aexmhdw.text: Right as I walked in, A very friendly owner made me mark on the map of metro Detroit where I'm from, got jealous of my 248 area code, gave me a rewards card and right as I started ordering said "you know what you're doin." Needless to say, we have found our new regular spot. This place is a perfect slice of the Dirty D with all the brands and flavors from back home.

ysvFzMwr2QAGBryhSDUWXQ.text: Native Michigander living in AZ. I love, love, love  coney dogs. I miss coneys, purple cow, better made, sanders, etc. I live in Glendale, AZ. I saw DCG on  Facebook Friday night and decided we would head over there for lunch the next day. I've tried coneys before from a restaurant that sold itself on food from back home. We tried it and weren't impressed. So, I was skeptical. I ordered 2 Detroit coney dogs, a Rock n Rye Faygo and coney fries. I also knew  (from  Facebook) there may be Superman ice cream in the near future...if it wasn't already all sold out. The coney dogs tasted a little bolder than I remember. But, I also tasted memories. So,  these coney dogs passed the taste test and ripped my skepticism into teensy shreds of nothingness. The Faygo pop was awesome as always. To wrap up my time in coney heaven, I ordered Superman ice cream and a Faygo pop to go. The ice cream is exactly as I remembered. My better half had never had this ice cream so we shared the ice cream. He loves it.  Btw, customer service is top-top-top notch. This place is worth the 30-minute drive each way. Perhaps some day it will come to the West Valley. If/when it does, I'm a be a regular. I  DCG.

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Superman ice cream and Faygo pop

oeKnwDBRNCwcXuqOdHI6_Q.text: This is the real deal. I lived on Detroit Coneys for 50 years while working in downtown Detroit and going to hundreds of sporting events in Detroit. The coneys at Detroit Coney Grill are exactly what I remember. The hot dogs have that same snap and the chili is the best of any Detroit style Coneys. The big bonus here is that the French fries are better than anything you can get in Detroit. They are hand cut and are the equal of Five Guys. All in all a great meal.

py7eMrNbHuqQsxZL__CDoA.text: great food, and the manager will come check up on you personally unless they are slammed. Would definitely recommend

LzjSWSvkDhcLMnFTgxUCjw.text: A little taste of home (if you're from MI) out here in Arizona.  Vernors, Faygo and coneys!!!  Come here and get your fix (even if you're not from MI).

r3v-3d_o_GTO4_johh3i2g.text: This is the current spot that takes care of my 'cheat' day. The combo dog with chili and loose meat is fantastic and the cheese fries are also really good.

1RZtLca29imc_xX2HlOlIw.text: Love this place the burgers are so good & the fries are some of the best in the valley. Try the big D next time your here I highly recommend it.

5n8uri27TF6S8-Y8R3N62Q.text: This is the best place    I am from Detroit so it's great to have a place that I can go to when I need some comfort food from the motor city!!   Love the coney dog!!  and faygo... I have sent most of my friends by to get a coney!!!

4xmOj5j6AgCGOtz0ACVnWQ.text: Not sure what the dizzy is about this place unless your from MI I suppose. Nothing special about a chili hot dog with home made fries.  Not great but not bad!

HUP1P3nGVV_vJhK39oUaMA.text: Incredible food that is as authentic as you can get. My boyfriend and I went for the first time tonight and after finishing dinner we ordered a second dinner each lol. I am from Detroit and the food was just like home for me. Hands down this is the ONLY place I would recommend outside of Detroit for a good coney. David, the owner, is as welcoming as you can get and so passionate about the food and making sure  it takes like home. If you're not from Detroit you'll still find this place to be the best you ever had.

CwM7vySXMvoGUsCLvWYf_w.text: I've been supporting Dave since the very beginning! He is personable and exudes customer service. He makes sure you leave happy and full :) I switched it up today and got the Hani! Reminds me of Kerby Melt (all my Michigan people who know Kerby Coney Island) but better! Well that'll be my new fix until I need my authentic coney again! And there was a line today because of 50% off don't be scurrred it goes fast (and your food still comes out hot)! Check in and get 10% and get the five stars card so your points add up and get a free coney! Look  I'm telling you all the hook ups! Try it you won't be disappointed!

5w6dLStJM59BG8wNpIdgww.text: This place was great! If you're in the Tempe area, you should definitely give this place a try. Next time I go I'll definitely try the chile cheese fries.

YQTca4cwq2mQvVnVmxctEw.text: This place is great!! My favorite is the fries!! The hot dogs are so good (I recommend getting two if your hungry) I also LOVE the gyro. I highly recommend this place!

MXpFpAC2AS4odWLxyFW4sA.text: Everything was great! The staff is so nice and friendly. We happened to find the place on Yelp and thought what the heck we are always homesick for coneys being  from Michigan originally. We were in heaven! The food was just like being home. The Faygo pop was awesome! We left grinning from ear to ear.

taxQZtqhruUEG_MTgnMfOQ.text: My girlfriend is a Canton, MI native and I've heard plenty about local delicacies. Detroit Coney Grill delivers: the coney dog was great, and they have a wide selection of Better Made chips and Faygo. As a current Tucson resident, I would love to see a location open in our University area. We both think it would be a hit, and I would have a place to fuel my growing Rock & Rye addiction.

I2FdzN_Lo0uX02R9hB7eVw.text: This place is AWESOME!!! Great food, friendly staff, good value. Only knocks I have are the place needs to be larger and the self service area could be better. But that's a problem in a lot of places.

1iwlbgQt2B7ga2PZHvkZPQ.text: If you're a fellow Detroiter this is your home away from home; great food, service, and atmosphere. They even have hani's!!!! I moved to Deming,NM 4 years ago from MI and I miss the food the most. I came to AZ for my birthday and getting a hani and a rock n rye was the best birthday present ever! Please please open one up in Las Cruces, NM, I will keep you in business!!!

JHMAJ0sQbVilCCWG3rnptw.text: We took our sons and a friend for a 16th Birthday dinner by request from the Birthday Boy.  My son really wanted to go because they are the only place that serves Faygo that we have found in the area.  We all walked in to a very packed whole in the wall.  The place has a great atmosphere and the gal at the register greeted us immediately.  She was very patient as three teenagers and two adults ordered half the menu.  We had a great time, the food was delicious, and everyone was completely satisfied when we left.  The boys even got to take home extra empty Faygo bottles.  Don't ask me why, I didn't bother asking them why....lol

l2m_dVdurqGJn6zxxMgTqw.text: Had two coney dogs and cheese fries. It taste just like they do in the D! Coming from Scottsdale and I'd definitely recommend it to anyone who's used to the coneys in Detroit and surrounding areas. Food was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Not to mention they have rock n rye and cream soda

WytOy_oKoJvdU6QlIrwF3A.text: Good food, Detroit loose burger was great, the Detroit Coney Combo was outstanding, fresh cut fries was very good.  Prices were very reasonable.  Granddaughter had the double burger thought it was super.  Owner was very hands on and made the experience even more enjoyable

G6-wmtceoe-SFQCFASzajQ.text: Faygo Soda brought back memories. Chili dog was great. A few onions go a long way. Don't over do it unless you really like fresh chopped white onions.  The curly fries were just ok. I was expecting Cajun seasoning with a little more flavor and bite. Not happening. Nothin special. The hot dog was good. Nice snap when you bit into it. Trust me on the onion thing tho. Oh yeah. I'm from Cincinnati and nothing beats Skyline Chili so take my review with a grain of salt.

t2NITmNsupTtaq37zY2HRw.text: The Coney's are simply amazing.  I love the crisp break you get in biting into the hot dog.  I love watching them cut my fries to order.

ReMD0QkwlSAQ3i4FZO130Q.text: I tried this place for the first time yesterday. I'm originally from Detroit and I love real Detroit Coney dogs. Only place I could get them was back in Michigan or to bring the ingredients back here to Arizona when I travel up there. These are real Detroit Coney dogs it was just like being back home. The food was excellent the service was great and the people are very nice. I had the Coney dog, Chili Cheese Fries and Faygo Rock & Rye it was so good! I'm so glad they are in town and I'm hoping they will open one in the East Valley. I live in Apache Junction and would love to have one closer to home but will definitely drive to Tempe if I have to. It's worth the drive!

OzHeAQQOW7sJwfCCAq2grw.text: Yum... Yum.... Good food friendly service. Coney combo ...sooo good. Fries......? Sooo good.   The food was good.

ezMt1STEFzapANnmeAR7Aw.text: Best dog hands down in AZ popping deliciousness in to every bite! The dog literally snaps with the same freshness the hand cut fries have. Highly recommend the Detroit Coney combo with some fries , either spiral or regular cut (even recommend the red hot fries;) Service was as authentic as the food, which is bonus points with how funny the owner is, and we were served with 'Detroit' written in mustard on our coney! Word to the wise to those who wisely chose to eat here, you never ask for ketchup on a coney! detroitconeygrill.com

rclXPCBxnDOQCTXbOiC3Pw.text: I live in Chandler, Az.  My fiance has been raving about this hot dog joint for months now. Finally he took me here earlier this week.  First thing I noticed is how friendly and upbeat the guys are that work here. (Owner perhaps, super nice. Even came by our table to make sure everything was to our liking) I ordered a double cheeseburger and my guy had a Detroit coney combo. Man, they were both awesome! I loved the crunch the dog had and also the chili was amazing! The burger was delicious too! We will definitely be coming back. Hopefully they can open a new joint up in the Chandler area. Enjoy!

UGY5iWE3Fo2qWSpi8o8KpQ.text: I've never been so excited to eat in my life. This was so delicious! The owner was so sweet and it was super packed. Which showed that it definitely is a good restaurant! And it's around the corner from me:)

6euJXt1qUlXeSky0dq9Gqw.text: Read the review in the Arizona Republic and had to try it.  Real beef hot dogs, chili was great on top, fries were perfect.  The show stopper was the Burgers! Patties are thin, so the triple was about right.  We live in Queen Creek, so until they open one out here, we'll have to drive to Tempe.  Definitely will be returning!

Hnalnna09UX4th1jDp56zQ.text: This place was awesome! The food was fanatic, the service was amazing, the atmosphere is fun and I totally can't wait to come back. Open up a place in central Phoenix! The staff were super friendly and the price is really good for the amount of food you get!

EDqGAq_Yx1_WwyMUoWxV_A.text: great Coney dogs and delicious frys, can never go wrong with a chili dog at this place and way cool owner who knows his Detroit sports

nLGIrYo7UNNOwSK5UJRMPA.text: Walked in one day and have been going ever since.  This place has excellent food and the service is even better.  They need to open out in chandler area.

UvQsA1UypqyN2ggpdIMQ6A.text: We had the Wednesday 2 Coney Dog special! It was good and the lady was very sweet and helpful since it was our first time visiting!

8ahu95SWLE1pqKZSjMfpyA.text: Best rendition of the "d" coney dog! Salute to the owner for bringing a little piece of home to AZ. FOOD IS AMAZING! Recommend a coney dog, chilli cheese fries and a rock and rye faygo to wash the goodness down.

ALwzbkh3oGqqFluw3l7xrA.text: Excellent quick hot food. I had the coney dog, fries and a pop. Excellent customer service.

KMzVKW6ZmKluH0ZeMl-5qw.text: Great food, Had the soccer game on top it off. I'll be back next time I'm in Phoenix.

K7A29hG7WeKHLW6r6QnRWg.text: I moved to Arizona about two years ago from Michigan and every time I would visit home I had to go to a Coney Island to get my fix... Now it's not as necessary since we finally have one here!!! And let me tell you, it's the real deal. We met the owner our first visit; he's an awesome guy from Michigan with a real love for what he does. He imports the coney dogs straight from Detroit, along with Faygo & Better Made chips!  I got the Hani, which I usually get in Michigan, and it tasted exactly the same!!!! I can't tell you how happy I was! I've been to restaurants who try to mock the Hani or imitate it slightly... It's always a let down. But the Hani at Detroit Coney Grill: LEGIT!! I overheard the guy at the table next to me (also a fellow Michigander) say how awesome the coney dogs are too. How could they not be, though? They're straight from the D!!! I plan on trying everything on the menu and I plan on being extremely satisfied with it all as well. ;) The atmosphere is fun & filled with Detroit pride. It's also very clean! There were tons of Michigan people there too, which is always fun to talk to fellow Michiganders with that Midwest, humble mentality. The service was great - everyone who works there is super nice!! Quick too! The owner was chatting with us for a while when we were there which was really nice. You can tell he just wants to see his customers happy. It's nice to finally have a little piece of Michigan here in Arizona! I can't wait to come back!!! I'm bringing all my friends too, to show them Michigan knows what's up when it comes to good food! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. While you&#39;re waiting for your order, put a pin on the map to show where you&#39;re from! :)
Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. The Hani (I ordered no tomato) - Sooo good!!! Tasted just like it does when I order it in Michigan!

TM40mx3OeaiX-iCTyxmQRg.text: Holy shit... Best food. Best service. All around awesome. We got coneys and fries and to day they're the best I've had. Would recommend to anyone.

EJQhmVqq9HgAFG8LlUhnsQ.text: Man, This is the real deal.  I discovered this last night and then took my entire office out for lunch there today.  These are the REAL hot dogs!  I grew up eating these things.  The owner is super energetic and friendly.  The fries were outstanding, but for me?  A Coney Dog is a taste of "Michigan Soul Food" and DCG has it.  If you grew up in South East Michigan you will want to get in your car and head over there now.  I can't believe I am so lucky that this is right down the street from where I work.

IlYKrvJCCH7FE6KLQKCqmQ.text: Best freaking coneys and loose meats ever! Delicious and service was outstanding!! A True gem and Chrissy and Danille took excellent care of us so that I definitely recommend this place as highly as I am able. If you are in Arizona at all and do not come here it is TOTALLY your loss!!!

OXWpPmjdYr6DCC5uwJ77Hg.text: Just ate there coming from Cali returning to Texas. Best decision ever. Owner was awesome and even gave us a free coney dog because he knows that it's the bread and butter of his business. The Quad burger with cheese and bacon was one the best burgers I have ever eaten. Need this place in San Antonio on the far west side as soon as possible!

ChrVqeD0rL81X3IJdKiCqA.text: I have to come here to get a taste of home. The next best thing to growing up a block from Tony Pacos.

BtycrXWXsgy73zk23PIGDw.text: Awesome! Great food, friendly service, quality products. I love this place & I'll be back & refer it to my friends! Love the chili coney & Faygo soda. Fries are delicious and made fresh. Try it & you won't regret it!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chili Coney combo, Chili coney &amp; loose meat cheese burger   :)

1VGWDoLKHzYsm6d5PqYc2w.text: This place is bomb!!! Get the Big D! The hand cut fries are amazing as well, only complaint is they could be open later! ;)

7cIENI_DwKE5m7xhnzTAuQ.text: So you're from Detroit and you want a coney. This is the only place to go.    Fresh ground beef, house made chili... That oh-so-important snap of the dog.  It's all here.     It's worth the drive, no doubt about it. We will gladly make the drive from east Mesa again and again!    Oh, glass bottle Faygo and Better Made chips are icing on the cake.  You interested be disappointed!

kt1w3zCaj76X8v10VomM5Q.text: The food is great, the place is clean and the staff is friendly!  Next time you're headed to Teds, stop in at the Detroit Coney Grill.  You won't be disappointed.

MYTcjrVdr4nnBCb5PQ7Eyw.text: This is probably the only good thing about Detroit.  No wonder these owners moved to Arizona.  Detroit bashing aside--this place is top notch.  You can even get beets with your burger.  I know it sounds wild, but it tastes more amazing than it sounds.

7KrAwMJiXISi7O_bypcF0Q.text: The food is phenomenal!!  The food is what mid-west is all about!!  If you want great mid-western style burgers and dogs this is the place to go!!  They sell pop in the bottle!  Old school Faygo!  This is the place to go!!! The staff is super friendly!

SM3o_jfyy6MvwZ4iUP1evA.text: One word....LEGIT!!!! Being a Detroit native I had my doubts about how "authentic" this place would be. However it tasted, looked and smelled like home :) This place is the only place that has authentic Detroit style coneys in the Phoenix area. Other places in the area advertise Detroit style coneys but don't even come close (many use hormel chili and skinless hot dogs....yuck)!!! This place is the real deal and even get their products shipped in from Detroit!! The owner is a super nice guy and came out and talked to us for a few minutes! So if you're looking for a REAL Detroit style coney look no further this place is the real deal!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Detroit coney dog and cheese fries

AB5AfFFamyUJpaxdI9Bqww.text: Awesome food the owner is from Ferndale Mi. my old high school rival in basketball. I am a Southfield native.  The food here is exceptional and they do it just like in the D.  Would eventually like to see the old Fish dog and a patty melt on the menu like 8 Mile Coney Island....lol....don't hesitate to try this place out. They even had the Michigan State game on when I came there. Made a brotha get all warm and fluttery inside. Nice clean facility food is prepared right in front.Way to represent the D.

CfD5cEqlIoNtMORJsVptCg.text: Best coneys and fries......EVER! The guys that work here are super nice. Tony (i think) was my cashier and he was very helpful and patient. Prices are good and the food is even better. Will b back.

qITDrAQxvxx6CJtUZD2Ddg.text: I've been living in Phoenix for 18 years. That means I've spent 18 years having coney withdrawal. Finally, Arizona has the real deal. If you are from Detroit you have to come here. I've been here 3 times. It's been great every time. If you aren't from Detroit you should still check it out. Have a type of hot dog that is different (and better) than any dog in your life.  And rumor has it that the burgers are very good too but I cannot confirm as I haven't tried it yet.   Just one complaint: time to add MSU photos to offset those UGLY UofM photos on the walls.

PdQxuPIhvpxUMdXuxC0rIQ.text: Anybody who knows what a Detroit Coney Dog tastes likes... needs to check this place out. I've been out here for years and now for finally found the right place. David (owner) welcomes all as family. A little slice of home... here in the valley!

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Keeping it real.

btuoX91jM_D9CSpElcLo-g.text: The salad wasn't impressive. The burger patties are ridiculously small. The food was cooked well and it was as close to home that Ive had so far. Great service as well. Clean dining area.

vDowjjZ_tuRQ1nPIwe1v8A.text: Found DCG by accidentally and LOVED IT! The coneys are great, but  the burgers are amazing. I've been bringing co-workers here for lunch, and it's become an office favorite. Now, we try to come at least once a week.  The service is impeccable. The owner, Dave, truly seems to care about the food and his customers. He personally takes the orders, makes recommendations and greets every table. Plus, they are FAST! At times, my order is done fresh before I even get my drink.  If you haven't been, make a point to stop by. You won't be disappointed!

Nnk4AWzZ2PwVBf2wU5qsng.text: Great Food, Great Service, and very easy to drive by it. Slow down and look for this spot on the north side of Broadway in that little strip mall and life will be good.

oisbDoayyuEoo0TWXnS6Ag.text: Absolutely amazing! A True taste of home from Detroit! I Love in LA now and was working out here in Tempe and saw this and had to stop! Great food, David was so welcoming. Felt like I was home! Will definitely be coming back every time I'm out here for work. Would love to see them get up to LA area!!

n0y_1L5bKZrpORbqd_5fLw.text: Well, it finally happened. The Burger Guy found a burger in Arizona so inspiring it's motivated me to come out of hiding. In case you're wondering, which you're probably not, because you live in AZ and likely have no idea who I am, but if you were wondering... I moved to Phoenix, AZ five years ago and retired the LA Burger Tour. I may resume it one day, as I still hear about new awesome burger places in LA I haven't tried. Anyway, on to the review!  The Burger - 9 (out of 10) As previously mentioned, the Burger Guy has lived in the Phoenix area (the Valley of the Sun as it's locally known) for five years, and you can bet hundreds of Phoenix burgers were consumed in that time. Well folks, I can confidently and definitively say this is the best burger in the Valley, (Ok ok well it's my favorite at least). Often the best burgers need the fewest words, so I'll keep the description short. These are almost certainly the thinnest burger patties I've ever come across, and I'm sure that is part of the magic. The bun, meat, and cheese all come together in perfect harmony, and I would say the key word with this burger is cohesive. The flavors just blend together wonderfully. Get it anyway you like, but I strongly recommend the triple. It's the perfect meat to bun ratio. The Burger Guy likes his with both kinds of cheese, bacon, grilled onions, lettuce, pickle, and the holy trifecta of sauces (one of the few burgers I like ketchup on). This may be my favorite basic burger in the world!  If you get a chance to meet the owner, David, you will see the passion that is behind this truly special burger. The whole staff is awesome and will make you feel like a welcome friend.  Phoenix Burger Tour (Burger rating is out of 10. Ratings are for flavor of the burger ONLY, and other factors like ambience, service, and price are not considered).  -Detroit Coney Grill 9  The burger at DCG is so good it's inspired me to do a Phoenix Burger Tour. I'll post my next reviews in the coming weeks. Until then, here is one last posting of the LA Burger Tour list:  The LA Burger Tour  -Yuca's 8 -The Counter 7.25 -Chano's 6.5 -The Oinkster 8.25 -Father's Office 9.25 -The Foundry 9 Henry's Hat 6.75 -Slow Club (San Francisco) 9.75 -Capitol Burger 7 -Cassell's 7 -8oz 8 -25 Degree 6.5 -The Golden State 9 -Apple Pan 8.25 -CommeCa 8.5 -Fix 8 -26 Beach 7.25 -JNJ Burger Shack 8 -Master Burger 7.75 -The Bowery 9 -Fatburger 7.75 -Umami Burger 8.75 -Juicy Burger 8.5 -Oaks Gourmet 8.75* (*Maggie did not vote) -Hawkins 7.25 -Irv's Burgers 7.5 -Rustic Canyon 9.5 (Maggie not voting below) -5 Guys 8 -The Habit 8.25 -In N Out 8.25

JtBWaz-4FTFMaqAYwoNbyw.text: Super friendly owner and staff...great Coney dogs...good curly fries...highly recommend the red Faygo, delicious...

A-qYSVQf4chLtOQR9Kh1Qw.text: The guys here at DCG have some serious passion for the Coney Dog and the action they have going on is pretty cool as well. Inside is full of fun items to make you feel like you're back in the Detroit area and then some. Take your time and check out the walls.  I've never been to Michigan but do love THE DOG. Been here a couple times and usually order a couple of their famous Coney Combos. Even broke down and had to test out some of the Chili Cheese Fries. Nice!  Really like the way the Dog pops in your mouth as you bite into them. The Hand Cut Fries are made fresh to order and you can definitely tell the difference. They also have Burgers, Pitas, Salads and boneless Chicken Wings as well.  The food is pretty good and most people seem to rate this place rather high. I'm inclined to go with an A-OK since the Chili or Coney sauce just did not have much of a thrill factor or flavor profile for me and the hotdogs are little on the pricey side.  Give them a try and see what you think. This is one of those regional flavors that you are going to enjoy more if you are from that area. I tend to lean toward the Windy City when hankering for a special treat. BEEP BEEP!  3.5 STARS

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Detroit Coney Combo Dogs and some Chili Cheese Fries.

HZqS5Eg3-k_w9ntDWslvAQ.text: Great food and service! I had the Coney Dog with Chili Cheese Fries and a strawberry Faygo. It was delicious and messy  Very fresh food and made to order. The owner is nice and very funny! Will be back

qYZ3SFq7xM2HFcDrEcowog.text: Little out of the way from the typical tourist areas, but it was convenient after a morning at LEGO land. Thanks to yelp, we found this gem. Onolicious burgers, dogs, fries, chili cheese fries, and onion rings. Soda selection was good too. Owner came by to ask how everything was, which was a nice surprise. Will be back for sure.

AN8Fa6R9fkM4Ia8D3lVIAw.text: This place is the best!  Ok, for starters. Anyone who has lived on the east coast, knows about Penn Station Subs. And you know how YUMMY their cheesesteak is. You also know, that there is NOWEHRE in the valley, that makes a cheesesteak that tastes remotely close to Penn Station...  UNTILL I tried Detroit Coney Grill.  While they don't make the sub version, their cheesesteak pita is a fine substitute...and the cheesesteak tastes JUST like Penn Station.  My ex-wife has been in the valley over 4 years, and was unable to find a cheesesteak like Penn Station.  Im glad I found Detroit Coney Grill!!  Now, as far as everything else goes..YUMMY!!  I have been trying to find someplace around that makes a chili similar to Tommys...and this is it.  The burger patties ARE small, but that's ok.  Get a triple, with chili..and you are SET!  The dogs DO have that familiar snap when you bite them.  I love the cheese sauce the use for the chili cheese fries...and the psudeo-Maid Rite loose meat they use for some of the menu items is delish as well!!  Imagine a tray of fries, covered in loose meat, then smothered in chili, then topped with cheese sauce.  GOOG GAWD MAN!  The owner and employees are super nice.   I had ordered a chicken philly pita with no mushrooms..but after the rest of my family had ordered, the owner, who was taking our order, had forgotten to subtract the mushrooms.  So when he saw me picking the mushrooms out, he apologized. Later, as we were finishing up, he came out from back with a bowl, that had 4 scoops of their Superman Ice cream...free of charge!  It kinda sucks, that now I have found this amazing place, I have to move up off of Happy Valley Rd.  Its ok. it wont stop me from coming back.  Thanks!

qWuuBnm-TQ_iSt80ma8ksA.text: BeSDT place in the entire world.   You should definitely come eat here because it is great food, great service, and isn't a place you will find anywhere except here and Detroit itself.

n91_MHRaED_6KMwNO-s-7g.text: So I haven't been to Michigan before which I suppose is where coney dogs are very popular but I was just about underwhelmed by the food here in almost every way. As far as the coney dog itself I really liked the chili that they put on the dog and of course the dog itself is quite tasty. Other than that I thought it was nothing too special that I couldn't get anywhere else. The fries did consist of huge portions but other than that they were fairly bland tasting.  It could just be me but I really don't understand all the great reviews and hype surrounding this place. Perhaps it's because I haven't had this kind of hot dog before but I feel that there are plenty of other options within the area for food. Having tried Ted's Hot Dogs before coming here I would rather go there instead and they also have better fries there.  I honestly do feel bad going against the many positive reviews on here but there was nothing much here than made me want to come back again.

Kvnu3aNHRjNKxkohp8OxLg.text: Honestly, no complains. Dogs cooked to perfection. They had great flavor and a very nice snap to them. Fries were very tasty and it was easy to tell they were fresh. Steamed buns so we're good there. Saw a few people eating the burgers. The patties looked really thin but the people eating them seemed to be enjoying them.  I enjoyed my Detroit dog (chili, mustard and onion), fries and creme faygo. Babygirl loved her dog, fries and grape faygo. They passed the princess test so there's something to be said for that. At 3 years old she's plenty picky!   We'll be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Babygirl having Grape Faygo...apparently that&#39;s what you&#39;re supposed to do.
Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Detroit dog and fries...had to go with the classic order. It was tasty for sure!
Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Outside view

yyabcLTIkrXQfgSXKbLnVg.text: Absolutely delicious Coneys.  I have been told that the fries are spot-on Detroit-style fries by natives.  The staff is always friendly and welcoming, prices are reasonable and they do have a few "value deals" available.  This would be a 5-star review if they had beer.

MxYHY2e7lZjI3DyrDkTjNg.text: I've been back multiple times, also to their new location in Mesa and Detroit Coney Grill is good. I stick with my gut and order the Coney specials Everytime but if your craving a Detroit Coney dog, or haven't had one, you won't be . Thank God for people that don't do disrespectful shit like put beans on my chili dog. I still think the fries aren't meant to be chili cheese fries but just get yourself here, eat, and be happy.

k4WsfsblkjxcazQA9NFygA.text: OMG I was really ready to like this place because I love chili dogs but no way! Had the Detroit Coney chili dog and first of all the bun was cold. Second of all the hot dog had the Natural Casing which I really do like but this casing was thick and resisting my eating the hot dog so I had to spit a lot of it out. The chili was sort of tasteless and didn't really add much flavor at all. If you want a great chili dog go to Tommy's or Pink's in LA...Very disappointing and won't be back.

5DaO5pTx5EQxfiuS-CjLZw.text: Staff was friendly, prices were reasonable, and the food was quick and delicious. The meat is ground in house, and the patties are thin and layered, with cheese between each slice (or so it seemed). Do yourself a favor and add avocado.   I loved my Cajun fries, while my husband thought the regular fries were good, but a touch soggy. I didn't notice that at all, though it could be because I dumped a ton of malt vinegar on them.   Either way, this is one of the best burgers either of us have had in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fighting the kid for my burger. She won.

JasjoyKm5AbChVi5OEK5FA.text: Found this place via Yelp! The stars on this place our perfect. The service is outstanding for one and place is clean. The food burgers were delicious and Fresh and priced perfectly for what you get! The topping are also fresh and tasty . Onion were crispy and yummy

rn1qMrPpBzRXFFsNbEVmEA.text: Great food and a good atmosphere here, you can tell they take pride in where they are from and put forth good food. Everything is great on the menu!!

AiRAMKRF_PK-NmjzqKuyLQ.text: Every time I walk into this restaurant it makes me proud to be from Detroit. I'm so glad there's an authentic coney place here in the valley. The food is amazing just like the ambiance. Towne Club and Faygo pop! Better Made potato chips! What a walk down memory lane. If I could give 10 stars on here I would, thank you Detroit Coney Grill for giving us Michigan transplants here in AZ a place where we can get good Michigan grub and a cool place to eat it at! Ain't no coney like a D-town Coney from Detroit Coney Grill

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Put your pin on the map
Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. D-town Coney love!

aPjmcNXFm1dpLBfv5BLa8A.text: Went here a year ago, happy that they are still around.  Everything is exactly as it should be. The owner is cool af.  Food is great.     Only complaint is the Ohio state rug that you have to step on to order.    But I guess that's what you would expect out of fans from"the team up north"

_usZYiwqlpC_UJrULv6DEQ.text: Stopped in for lunch after an airport run and looking on Yelp. Ordered a double cheeseburger and the owner asked how was my burger after a few bites. I said it was over cooked and dry. He immediately made me a replacement no charge and said "no one gets a bad burger in my place."  2nd burger was very good. Will return again!

2iRVpgADVlBYVkC4igbLfw.text: One of my Facebook friends posted about this place and I really had to give it a try so I cheated a bit on my diet and headed over. The Coneys here are really great, I only ordered one because of my diet but I REALLY wanted to eat about 3 and add some of those chili cheese fries.  When I get back in better shape I'll definitely be back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

YmhhUNnSqfAcEAsw86Lxxw.text: BEST BURGER IN PHX!!!!!!!!!!!!  There should be a secret 6 stars for this place!!  The owner is always working and helping out and asking how the food was and engaging to all of the customers!  I have been coming here for a couple years now and I go at least once a week since its down the street from where I work!  My go to order is the triple burger with cheese(both) the works with sauteed onions and a detroit coney with sauteed onions and a drink!  Honestly havent had anything bad here and is one of my favorite places to go for lunch!!!  I live in Ahwatukee and one should be opened up there so I can go more often! hahaha

dEudzjjY-mzJr8MY4XwXJQ.text: I am such a fan of Detroit Coney Grill, especially the Double Cheeseburger. I don't know what it is but the burgers are delicious, always fresh and hot! I usually order a side greek salad with my order to keep it a little healthier. But on a side note, everyone usually raves about the fries and onion rings! Please note, the patties are thinner so don't expect a huge burger.  Always get the works!

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Double Cheeseburger
Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Detroit Coney

t9lcZXb8P7k4tMaHudBfgQ.text: Wow, what a great place. I am a big fan of the Coney dogs here. The coney has a satisfying snap when you bite into it. The chili is excellent, but my favorite is the Coney fries. My colleagues tried the burgers and claimed they are the best they had in some time. I am so surprised by the food and the staff here. I will be back again.

eiCS2Uxi8-e7XtRExRRUug.text: Yum! First time here! We had no clue what to order, so the owner provided us with a great suggestion... A little bit of EACH! We shared a burger, a dog, a loose meat sandwich and their outstanding fries! Everything was DELICIOUS! REALLY glad we decided to make a pit stop, before hitting the road back to Vegas, where we don't have one of these!  If you're from the Detroit area and miss a taste of HOME.. Or, if you're in the mood to try some good eats, check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

aVYVzg1kwswCFQjS40RoUA.text: Came in for a later lunch and got the Detroit coney dog, which came with chili, mustard and onions. The hot dog was delicious and the fries were so crunchy and perfectly fried. The dinning area was a bit full between those dining in and those waiting for to go orders but the staff are quick and before I knew most people had left. Everyone was friendly, the owner spoke to multiple tables and asked how everything was and the place was pretty clean. I can't wait to go back again to try their burgers!

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Detroit coney with fries.

wntGkuP8_fnbUvBfJwgrEQ.text: Great dogs and now that I got out of the rut of eating the same two coney special for months and finally opted for the big D burger, it reminds me of the maid-rights my grandma used to make.  Luckily my wife only eats one of her dogs so I get both a coney and burger when we go.  Great food at a great price and with awesome service, the folks in there are friendly and take pride in the delicious food they serve.  My only regret is there isn't one in South Chandler, but this one is still worth the drive when I'm craving a coney and a messy yet tasty burger.     I can't not mention the fries, they do them up right, reminds me of the fries served in a paper cone when I was in the Netherlands, awesome.

Yg78eACNddvuKt0vw1SYBg.text: So this place os amazing when you go in and eat but Ordering through grubhub has been really disappointing!  I have order through grubhub through yelp and both times I have been disappointed. My meal today was almost right. I added chili onto a cheeseburger and got basically no chili on the burger. Kind just a smear. I also asked for extra pickles and only got like 3 on my sandwich.  My fries were also undercooked and they sent no ketchup or anything with it.  They also forgot the straw for the drink.

eGxro3JbGhfcROnbPGTUgw.text: Wow! This puts Sonic for sure, and maybe In n Out, to shame. I've had the Detroit Coney Combo with their thick-cut fries. It was pretty damn good. The fries are excellent. Served thick and nuclear hot  The green chile Burger is awesome. My best description of their burgers would be large White Castle sliders. Though, I haven't eaten in a White Castle in 30 years. That's how I remember them.  I had a taste of my mom's Philly pita and that was delicious; a little spicy. I could eat chili cheese tots all day long. This is my second trip here and even though it's nowhere near home, I'm going to be a regular.

-9fKXV7evWI2zjxECwf3rg.text: Friendly service, great displays, relaxing atmosphere. Makes for an awesome lunch and experience. My fiance and I live in Washington State, and so wish that there was one of these eateries located near us.

DrPZn8niF0597khbqM_cng.text: One of the best burgers I've had in my life!  Seriously, I'm a burger girl and this skyrocketed to my top 3 burgers. It's the best traditional burger I've ever had.  If you are in the area, do not miss the opportunity to go to this place.  We aren't from here so unfortunately this can't be a weekly thing, but if I were local, I would have to go to the gym a lot more.  There are no gimmicks here. It's just amazingly fresh, high quality ingredients.  My husband and I had burgers, fries, onion rings and the wings. Everything was perfection. The owner and the other man working there could not have been friendlier. They clearly have pride in the business and their product. Every business could take pointers from these guys. Well done!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

FgB2bdnlnF_wADuihKI68Q.text: The burger Big Mac was pretty killer! I was hesitant at first because when I saw them cook the patties they looked super ULTRA THIN with empty spaces in between. But since they used 4 patties it was actually pretty decent sized and juicy!!! Nothing beats a juicy burger. The tater tots were not life changing; pretty basic and since they fry them in the same oil as the onion rings they  ended up tasting very salty and onion-ie. Was not a big fan of the price. Will I be back? Probably not.

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Ya Tater Tots
Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Big Mack &#34;Inaw&#34; Burger

ZRHdnd0GaMcqXLUu-VLdKw.text: After 30 minutes of trying to decided where my boyfriend and I were going to eat we finally chose Detroit coney grill. The pictures are what initially sold us. We were both in the mood for a good burger but wanted to try something new. AND THIS PLACE DID NOT DISAPPOINT. Their were only two women working at the time and they whipped up our order in a timely manner, we both chose the "The big "D" burger" combo. It was seriously one of the best messiest burgers I've ever had. Also, THE RANCH!  Will definitely be coming back and recommending to friends and family.

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

_bcTXeFFgNYk8qqsngjzQA.text: Fantastic burgers and service as well. Will definitely come back. Not sure why I've missed this place on my radar after so many years in Phoenix--but cheers grateful I know it now. Pinned the board!

Lh6XkiibnCOkzu11Dls4YQ.text: My husband and I found an affordable tasty restaurant. I got the Wednesday special. Which was two coney dogs, fries and a soda. It tasted delicious. My husband got the green chili burger, fries and soda. He was really happy with the food. It was filling and tasted great. The customer service was excellent.

1CGyPL-bfLrBhZgMpscbkg.text: Nothing is like a greasy burger.  My double cheeseburger with grilled onions hit the spot.  Burger has the fresh ground taste with a bit of grill burned edge.  Double was probably a little smaller than I thought. Moderate appetite needed the fries to complete the meal.  Those are also fresh cut. Which makes a difference.   I did pickup and it was done at early time for pickup. I will definitely find my way back.

gatxQ9zD9COrNaOi_NhJSQ.text: From Warren Michigan and love to come here and get Faygo and better made chips. Yummy food, and fast! I'm able to come here on my lunch break with colleagues and all get our food quickly. Monday special is coney dog, chili cheese fries and a drink and I couldn't eat it all it was too much food.

0IjvjV-D_3U7rUmT0amLDw.text: My husband and I loved it. He got a double cheeseburger and I got a chili dog, with hand cut fries. It was excellent. We will definitely be eating there again.

hINtBPRhug21p4hNZZQH9A.text: FANTASTIC! I got an email earlier today that Detroit Coney Grill got the meatless Beyond Burger Patties, so I decided to stop in and get one! I did a side-by-side comparison of a normal burger (triple stack) and the Beyond Burger, and they are seriously SO good! The Beyond Burger not only tastes and "feels" (texture wise) like a 'real' burger, but also LOOKS like a real burger, too! (Seriously; the inside of the burger was kind of pink!)  I've had other veggie burgers before but you can generally tell that those are plant-based. If I hadn't known already before trying it that this was plant-based, I never would have known. These are incredible, and I would highly recommend any vegetarians or honestly anyone who wants to try these to go and check them out at Detroit Coney Grill! 5 stars, hands down.

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Even the inside of the Beyond Burger looked like a &#39;real&#39; burger!
Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Detroit Coney Grill&#39;s Beyond Burger (meatless burger) was amazing!
Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Yum

YyuNZ6GcogRjOJoKLhKc9A.text: Second time here and it us just as good as the first time, DELISH! Friendliest people in the world, even the cook came to check on us. I will be back and bring friends!

PMETC2RSM__Ks6JX1IYP3w.text: Let's start out by saying this isnt my first time here, but it will be the last. Everytime (3) I've been here I'm disappointed . Its Saturday PM and I've been in bed sick since Thursday pm. I needed to eat and this place is close to my house. I thought hey, I'll go get a cheeseburger and fries. For my first meal in 3 days I'm pissed. 2 kids behind the counter that dont care about the place. Receipt machine isnt working and not a thank you for the buck I put in there lack of tips in a tip jar. The fries were pieces of old fries, and the burger just looked gross. I'm so hungry, I eat everything anyway. Next time I'll drive an extra mile or 2 to get a good burger. Btw, I also chose this place because I didnt want to fight university traffic on a Saturday pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Just yuck
Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Gross burger
Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

qgGcEgVCSodd6xFCDdA6dg.text: In terms of fast food, I really enjoyed the service and food options. However, because of the cost and yelp reviews, I had some pretty high expectations for the portions (yes, that is very American of me to complain about). I split a coney combo (2 chili dogs and fries) with my husband about $10 total). While that's a pretty great deal compared to other places, I am spoiled by the $1.50 hot dog combo at Costco. Accordingly, I expected a hot dog that was Costco-food court size and I expected more chili. The hot dog itself was fine, but again, compared to Costco, I found it to be higher on the processed-food taste than I expected. That said, it was PACKED with happy customers and I still plan to try out their chili cheese fries soon. So, even though I didn't rate a 4 or 5, I would still recommend experiencing this place!

AK399KVrkwOlNvsArCwiiw.text: Its great to see people that genuinely care about the food.  Hand made dogs, hand cut fries, in house ground-ground beef.  Well done Detroit!  Will eat for lunch here often, for sure.

yoHA797lXqJ3fr4_FqS9kQ.text: Best hot dog I've had since I moved out here; you can't beat natural casing :^) Chrissy's service was great too, if I wasn't broke I would have left a tip :v)

ftWNy6isbB444Y14KA88HQ.text: Awesome burger and the chili cheese fries are unreal. They make their own chili, fries, and grind their own beef into patties. Reminds me of food back home.

6i3sXmtdE24rAxoEoi5Dhw.text: I can't say that I'm still hungry, the portions are large and the taste is good. This did in fact taste like a fresher, more meaningful Big Mac. The thousand islands has become a postmark to MCD. The fries are great and will definitely go there, the meat on the burger was thin, (it must be something to do with the custom) in not a big fan of that. But over all it was a great experience. I can wait to try the hot dogs.

x4skZvx5oGw4n_C9UYHnlA.text: Really liked my triple burger with fries, super nice employees who even say hello and goodbye

3HcIeYaOVhoPgZZt0t2bfQ.text: This place is the real deal for coneys.  Best in AZ and in a blind taste test I bet you'd have trouble telling which chili was "made in Detroit" and which was made in Tempe.  Even better they do not short you on the chili.  They provide enough to where it overflows just a little bit with each bite.  Additionally, they also give an ample amount of chili on the chili fries so that you don't have all the ones on the bottom without chili.    My only complaint, if you can even call it that, were the fries themselve were not exactly like you'd get at a coney in Detroit.  This is not to say they are not good...because they are very tasty...they are just different.

8LGAyAW0tAydDHBK32Hxeg.text: Excellent food and great customer service. I have tried this location and the one in Phoenix so far and the atmosphere of this location is like walking into a relatives house from the moment you walk in. I ordered the Gyro Pita and a Detroit Coney and throughly enjoyed both. The staff was engaged with their customers with casual conversation as well as asking for feedback. Definitely will be a place I return to!

WjdTruh5xyWh0_L5PQVCqA.text: Good tasting hot dogs and I got a Faygo Red Pop.  The owner was nice and came around to talk with every table.

CiC3nsRS_fkdmT-E1OWXWA.text: Can I just say that this place.. Is AMAZING! Tastes just like the coney dogs back home. I'm so glad I discovered this place. My sister and I have been in twice now coming from paradise valley. They DEFINITELY need a location by us!! The owner is a super nice guy and his staff is great too! No complaints!

cVmzyQnycvbFPjvKVfctyA.text: This place is legit! Real Detroit coney and awesome fries! Love everything about this hot dog joint!

LkhJJbrMTY78gfUeGSCKSg.text: Growing up in Detroit's I would go to a Coney Island a few times a month. Having lived in Arizona for 20 years I've never been able to find an authentic Coney Island hot dog until yesterday. Both my wife and I said after taking our first few bites this is exactly how I remember it. Hot dog, the chili, the atmosphere it's like being in downtown Detroit all over again

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

39AuaoiSni_g5VcAVXjyOQ.text: Detroit Coney Grill deserves 10 stars... Some of the best food in Tempe right here. Obviously this establishment is known for their  coneys, but let me tell you, them burgers will go toe to toe with some of the most proclaimed burger spots in the valley. Highly recommend the newer menu choices, such as the "Big Mack-inaw" which is their spin on the big mac, equipped with 4 thin beef patties, 3 pieces of bread, and some of that *secret sauuce*. "The Big D" is another local legend which is pretty much a blend between a quad (maybe a triple i forgot) burger loaded with chili. Lets just say you'll need a fork and knife for that one. Apart from the great food, the owner always is there to enthusiastically greet you, ask you how your day is. Nothing is better than an establishment where ownership genuinely cares about their customers. Keep on doing your thing Coney Grill.

Flu1cnN8K_E8Zy54CMkBsw.text: Come eat till you can't walk it's great fresh fries, n best burgers. Must try the chili cheese fries and try burger but don't stop there need to get a coney dog too so come on a Thursday

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sauce cheese fries and burger

e9zfQgr7urdpAIK6L1PRtw.text: My Co worker and I are visiting from CA and decided to try out Coney Grill, and I have to say it was one of the dogs I have ever had. The owner David came and greeted us and the staff was great. If your ever near Tempe go try Coney Grill

n5sEo6dVHVSRiU1P_dxblQ.text: From Mesa on Higley and Brown. Best damn dogs you can find outside of Michigan. Worth the drive, wherever you are from! You won't be disappointed.

y3tAm-wQ7B8bzzqydVFOkw.text: Ok so I have never had a "coney dog" and it is this places saving grace had chilly dog burger and chilly cheese fries. Chilly dog awesome very good. Burger was very small pattie with no patty flavor. Chilly cheese fries worst part of the meal the fries were almost burnt and cheese sauce was flavor less I could not even eat them. I would recommend for coney dogs only

8e_Ea6XjbLV0s0mGF5vpKg.text: Great place.  More of a 41/2.  Came in a couple days ago and had the special of 2 coney dogs and a drink for 8-9 bucks.  Also ordered the loose meat sandwich and chili fries.  Everything was awesome.  The natural soda brand from MI they carried was outstanding stuff too.  Of course, they call it pop.  The owner and staff were super nice guys and we look forward to going back.  They're thinking about opening another location so hopefully it will be in Gilbert near San Tan Mall.  Hint hint.  We live right by there.

ZzGX-syKJ6TkpLgdTAnWpA.text: I have had the pleasure of eating many Coney dogs in MI over the years. Everyone has their favorite place to indulge. Mine would be Angelo's in the Flint area. There was a tiny part of me hoping they would surprise me with an olive burger but I don't think I saw one on the menu. At any rate, we split the basket since we needed a quickie before a movie down the street. My hubs who has never been to Mi, needed to be introduced to what a Coney was. Be was very impressed! I love this place and I find it comforting too see this little tiny piece of Mi in the desert. I will definitely be back! I discovered Detroit's in the Entertainment Guide. Most of my favorite places were discovered via the Entertainment Guide. I am somewhat new to AZ and there are so many choices. It basically serves as a compass for us. That and Yelp of course. I will be back! #yum Now if we could get our own little Frankenmuth. Awe, good times in Mi. P.S. the Blue Moon made my day to say the least. I snuck the rest into the movie and savored it in the dark. And now I see on FB that they are serving Superman ice cream tomorrow. #memorylane

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

Stduk3u81_JC1c2uqjGfZQ.text: Had lunch here today after reading this place on "Yelps top 100". They were rated #30 on the list and after eating here I see exactly why! So much flavor in the food. I had a chicken philly pita and would recommend it to anyone! The owner suggested a coney dog and I had one too. First time trying a coney but it won't be my last.  The food didn't take long and the price was just right. I would recommend everyone to give this place a try! Two thumbs up!!

WwZ-qca0SMU3XABJPjC7mw.text: I've been here twice, and both times, I just don't get what the fuss is about.  Maybe it's just a matter of preference when it comes to certain things about hot dogs, but I'm not sure I'm a fan of the Coney dog served here.  To be fair, I've never had one before anywhere else, so I can't compare to other establishments.  The cashier was very friendly and she even read my name off my work badge somehow and called me by name the rest of the time I was there.  I think that's a really nice touch.  The owner too, he's such a super cool guy and I really want to like the food because of it.  I got a Coney dog with french fries that I added the option of putting Frank's Red Hot all over them.  I saw the new menu item, the big-mackinaw and had to try it also.  The dog - the onions had a really off putting smell to them.  I don't know if they were old, or if it was the way that they interacted with the chili, but every time I brought the dog to my mouth, I was grossed out by the terrible smell of the onions.  It almost had that B.O. smell of old onions.  The snap of the dog, I love a snap, but this was REALLY snappy, kind of felt strange to me.  This chili is OK, I would add more mustard personally  The burger - huge!  Cooked to perfection, melty cheese, and then....the onions!  Nooooooo! There were so many onions on this burger, it completely destroyed my palate.  All I could taste was onion.  While I was in line, I was listening to each person's order, and it seemed like they were all ordering with no onions.  I remember thinking, if you come to a place, order it the way they make it, they know what they're doing.  By the end of my meal, I realized why.  Maybe it's not why THEY ordered with no onions, but I certainly would order with no onion next time.  The weird smelly onions on the dog, and the way too abundant amount of onions on my burger were enough to wonder what the hype is.  If you love onions, come here.  If you don't, order without onions.  The burger and the personality of the owner and cashier were enough for me to some day want to go back and order with no onions.

UHHHhWppv6ppYqhF0hqG6w.text: I saw a review of this place written by someone I know so my wife and I decided to try it out during National Hot Dog Month.  Nice that we did.  I hadn't had a burger this good since Burger 21 closed.  Nice and juicy.  Great fries and good hot dogs as well.  Just as importantly, I very friendly place.  It was fun to be there.  If today wasn't Sunday, I'd have gone back.  Two thumbs way up!

OJZiYAhzxT9ar1bXtZbQwA.text: I found this place randomly one day looking for a place to get a burger. I came in and the people are super friendly and very helpful helping you choose what you want to eat.   I've had the burger there (they grind their own meat) and it was one of the best burgers I've had. I went back on a later date and got the snap hot dog with mustard and sauerkraut and it was delicious.   I went today and got a chili cheese snap hot dog and it was amazing as well. The fries were crunchy and delicious. The staff comes to make sure you're enjoying your food and your stay. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a good burger or hot dog.   And this place doesn't only sell hot dogs and burgers, but they also have gyros and salads. So they have something for everyone. When you get the chance or are in the area, I recommend you stop by and get some friggin phenomenal food.

Dh_tEz-mxItV0WvMdQjM9A.text: If you're from MI, this is going to bring you back! Stopped in for lunch and left very satisfied. The chili was spot on! The cheese fries were really good too!   I dug into my lunch and forgot to get a pic, but I've added a pic of my boyfriend's coney combo.   The owner spoke with us and said he gets all his goodies straight from MI. We'll definitely be back here and plan on recommending it to all our friends from MI!

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Coney Combo, no onions.

chQ1nqMctLSKBFcfJ-MLyg.text: The burgers come fast and are cooked immediately. They absolutely melt in your mouth. The beef is sourced from Detroit. I can see why the burgers are rated 9th in the nation by food network. If you're looking for something different this is not it, but what they have done is perfected their burgers. I also had their coney and it crunches in your mouth when you bite into it. The fries are made out of actual potatoes and not the sorry frozen and mushy excuses for fries you see at other restaurants.

7uLaooQ-U0AcDKCQHvewPQ.text: Best burgers in town . I rarely dine at the same  place two days in a row, but my when my brother told me he was craving a burger, I dismissed the thought until he mentioned  Coney Grill. Boy am glad he changed my mind . Yesterday's meal was as good as it always is, but today both the burger and chili cheese fries were the best I ever had. If you do go with the burger, don't shy away from both cheeses, bacon, jalapeno, grilled onion, and feta... it's the only way to go.

qLcnIZYYfD88fGwae01r8g.text: This place is incredible! We moved away from the D 13 years ago and have seriously missed Coney Island's. We heard about this place from a coworker and came the first chance we got! We brought my mother, she uses a scooter for mobility and had zero issues scooting up to a table. The atmosphere and food are spot on Detroit!!! Please open a place in Queen Creek near queen Creek market place! Until then, we will gladly make the trek to dine regularly!

VfuNvsNqqHNqKEZi7gPRGg.text: Once again DCG did not dissapoint. From the hot dogs that snap when you bite them, to the coney sauce that covers everything with goodness. This place is a mainstay.  If you are from the valley..you owe it to yourself to try the food here. Grab a Faygo..a loosie and some Bettermade chips..savor each flavor and enjoy!

AUCEPL0mtrrlVsUQ_LwaPQ.text: Chili doesn't have much flavor. The Whole meal wasn't too bad, might come back to try another menu item. Nice people decent service, just didn't hit the spot.

Wt627DB8WSyb2G6uV54vZw.text: This place is SO friendly. They care about their customers and the food is BOMB. Good service, good food. 10/10

ulJX9UA4AmXV24MEDYcJKw.text: Best Coney's in town, need to open on the westside up by Arrowhead. Great food and service . We love coming here

bppFuV031pLiTwDLbDX23Q.text: Was looking forward to some awesome coney dogs and was meet with slightly bland chilli on a bland dog. It was a real disappointment for me. It gets a 2 out of 5, cause I liked the fries. Not really sure I'd recommend this place.   The service was good, but not enough to overcome the blandness of those dogs. Also, for what they charged it should have been much better then that. They made Circle K's hot dogs look good.

e67HqvkbJcdPrKah1Dl0yw.text: Awesome, My new recommendation to anyone who wants a fabulous meal at a decent price.  The cheese and chili with loose meat fries are to die for !!

DKp3LuLTYj1n5XFOc1Owbg.text: Oh my tummy is happy! My husband and son came here once before and raved about it. Tonight we all went. The handcut fries are perfect! The freshness of the Detroit dog definitely represented in the "snap" of the dog. Delicious! Staff was proud to serve these delicious dogs, super friendly and came to check on how we liked everything.   We will be back! Thanks Detroit coney grill for a delicious dog!

kn_sGHwzm6TOS6Iuwf7zww.text: With all of the hamburger and hot dog places clustered in Tempe, it takes a lot to stand out.  Detroit Coney Grill has that special something.  The patties in their burgers are thin, but they offer a "quint" or five patty burger that is like a double burger elsewhere.  Absolutely fresh, delicious, and juicy.  Order it any way you like and you'll get it to your table quick and with a smile.  Want more food?  You can get more patties--order 18 if you like and eat 'em if you can.  ASU students please take note--wanna do your own "Man vs. Food?"  Here's a delicious spot to do it!  Fries are fresh cut and tasty, and drinks are bottomless.    One of the top burgers in Tempe--TRY IT.

4DS-UxR4VPAnNrz_Q1tE8Q.text: I have been waiting for a piece of Detroit here in Phoenix. Anyone from the 313 knows that coney's make the world go round! This place delivers! Lafayette's chili is the best chili in Detroit, and that's what they serve.  Better Made chips, Faygo POP ( yup! That's what Detroiters call it!!) The owner is a down home Detroiter! This place delivers what we've been praying for. AND.. He is trying to open a place in the old Whataburger on Bell and 67th Ave. If you live in Glendale call or write the city to help get him on West Side. You have no idea  what you are missing!!! Detroiters UNITE!! Bring coney to our side of the city!!

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

6bgj71sq6M2SMc_LVxbJjg.text: Detroit city in the Sun!    Coney through and through.   The snap of a Vienna coney, brick chili, saucey cheese!   Oh!  And faygo, Vernor's and Towne Club ... Better made potato chips!   Staff, owner and food. ..  All genuinely awesome!   The drive from Casa Grande was worth it!   Let's all pray Casa Grande gets one!   Tammy & Steve!

VRElU8g2Pt1IKSjDQCf6CA.text: I stumbled on this place by accident. The food is great. My coworkers and I are eating here 3 times a week now. One of the best Greek salads I've ever had. Plus, the service is really good. Fast, friendly and delicious.

lMSO33qlO_sWw2JRsnQchQ.text: My husband and I are born and raised in Detroit and have been living in Phoenix for 2 years now. Somehow we didn't know about this place until this weekend. We made the drive from N. Phoenix and were VERY happy we did! The food was great, the service was amazingly friendly and the Detroit decor made us both so happy! Sitting there happily eating our coneys and listening to people talk about 696, Hazel Park, the Lions, Lafayette Coney Island was such a trip. Thanks for the bit of home here in the Valley.   I also loved the "pop" sign on the wall!   We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. As good as it looks
Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Awesome

7dB9U3wcMC8u6tRoLv1iZw.text: Wow! My honey comes here every week and finally brought us. I've never been to Detroit and never had a coney, but if the beautiful feast of chili, mustard and onions placed before me was any indication of what I was missing, I may have to plan a trip soon! Owner/manager was constantly working, circulating, checking in with tables - it's definitely an neighborhood hangout. So many people greeted by name.    They also have amazing looking Burgers (smashed on the grill) and pitas. Btw, chili cheese fries are amazing too! Come by and make yourself happy!

yieMkW-gjmtgh8HqZRfTqw.text: Not sure how this get into the 9th best burger in America.   I walked in with high expectation because of the reviews, but walked out with disappointment. It's not bad, but to me this is just like a typical burger and nothing really special about it.

aqyCICU6ZkSNKddFrlqdow.text: We tried this place today based off reviews I read here and on fb. Im always looking for new keto Friendly places to add to my list. This place was keto friendly to an extent.  First the pros: Food was fresh, easily could order without bun, had great topping options. Flavors were great! Avocado and bacon were decent.  Cons: burgers are only 2 oz - ordered 8 patties and probably the equivalent of 2 regular size patties. Toppings were sparse, i got one  lettuce leaf, one small slice of tomato, I asked for extra pickles and received 4 small chips. I paid $14 which I find to be heavily overpriced for the actual amount of food I got. If the patties were a lot thicker, then I would understand.  I can get 8 patties with the fixings at in n out for under $10.  This was a great place to experience but too pricey. I think if I ate fries and bun, it would be worth it. It gets tricky and overpriced with dietary restrictions.

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bunless burger - lettuce, tomato, avocado, bacon, pickle, mustard.

LwCXT1HHXBUa7lPaPIre5g.text: This place is so simple and unassuming it would be a mistake to launch into some superlative laden supercalifragilisticexpialidocious ad campaign about it because everyone would think my review is nothing more than a commercial paid for by the owner's mother. And aren't there already too many fake so-called restaurant reviews around already?  So let's avoid the hype.  This place isn't fancy, it's in a strip mall, the people who work here are just regular folks and the food is good but let's be real, it's not the best on Planet Earth.  It's not Michelin 5-star fantabulous, just normal, but I like it and I would come back again.   I ordered the closest thing on their menu to a basic cheeseburger and fries.  The price was just what I would consider fair, not quite as cheap as McD's but nowhere near the outrageous prices all these new pretentious chain fast food places are charging.  My double cheeseburger (the smallest they sell) with a regular fountain drink (the only size they sell) and a regular fries (ditto the only size available) ended up just over $8 bucks with tax.  That's a buck or two more than the equivalent meal at the franchise burger chains, about the same price as In 'n Out and about half what 5 Guys, Smashburger or similar overhyped places charge.  The sandwich guy made it the way I requested (lettuce, onion, pickle, mayo, mustard).  They didn't try to drown crappy meat in an over abundance of weird toppings so the net result was that I could actually taste the beef.  It was simple but good.  The fries, which they fresh cut all day, were simple and good.  The fountain drink was reasonable priced and the available options were simple and normal.  The decor is simple, the seating is simple, the place is kept clean, it's not filled with 1000 screaming kids bouncing in an ocean of fluorescent blue plastic balls. They don't try to shame you into automatically adding a tip with their credit card reader.  No one has fake smiles but then again no one looks grouchy either.  I'm glad my experience was simple because wading through the owner's website isn't. It's obvious his goal is to franchise and expand.  Phoenix is a hotbed for such startups, and some have been pretty successful at it.  I'm glad I caught them when I could still consider them a non-chain. I wish him well but honestly I'm not exactly sure what his magic ingredient is going to be that differentiates him from all the rest.  This restaurant seems too simple to be very memorable.

ZVALgmueVDfnkE-9OpdsjA.text: Great burgers and rings.  The Coney is pretty awesome as well. I drove up from Florence to try this place and it was well worth the trip.  The food takes a bit of time to come out which is fine as it is cooked to order, and the place isn't huge so during the week down by the campus it's got to be pretty crazy.  On a Sunday if I am in the neighborhood I will make sure to stop in though.

hnMvnELZXrrQS1DpxeU99A.text: First time here. I had to double fist with the Detroit Coney Combo and Green Chile Burger. The snap of the Coney was perfect. The Hatch Chiles were perfect - spicy. The only disappointing thing was the fact it all had to come to an end. I got full. Great place for the America's Burger Club. #dukeofeats

lCHF92YMx5VimZaoaJy_DQ.text: Good authentic Detroit Coney dogs! They have a few locations in the valley and they're from Detroit so you know they're legit. They always have faygo sodas which is a staple soda from Detroit. The menu is pretty diverse where you can get the staple Coney dogs, chili fries, and the delicious burger, but you even have some Mediterranean gyros and salads. Something for everyone!  I've been here a few times, I've tried out the burgers which I think is one of the best seasoned burgers out there. Thin patties and they grind their own burgers on site. Super good! With this trip I wanted to try the veggie pita with avocado. Something a little lighter but it's still very filling. Its pretty saucey of a pita but had all the right veggies in the pita. Pretty good! They also just started offering beer battered cheese sticks and they were talking them up. Gave them a shot and they tasted like an extra crispy battered cheese stick which I really liked. Always need some ranch on the side to dip them in. Give them a shot!  All around good place and really friendly owners. On the heavier side of food but you should know that when you go to a place like this.

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Philly cheese steak. Delicious!!
Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Front of Detroit Coney
Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Daily specials Monday thru Friday

L4YxEwC_kqlPuLxC2Ymtfg.text: I found this while searching online for local restaurants within walking distance of my hotel and wow!! am I glad I made the effort to seek this out.  Based on the presence of a gyro on the menu and the generous servings, I'm guessing there's a Greek in the kitchen... but I failed to ask, perhaps you will remember to inquire when you visit.  I chose the Wednesday special- 2 coneys, handcut fries and a fountain drink for $9.99. I went with chili, onions, mustard and cheese on both - and on the cashiers suggestion ordered one with shredded cheese and one with "squeeze cheese," also known as nacho or melted cheese. She shared with me that the squeeze cheese variant is what is considered the norm in Michigan, making this an educational as well as tasty dining experience.  The fries? Some of the best I've ever had. Cut and fried with incredible consistency. I used no ketchup, as I didn't want to ruin the flavor. The coneys were full length hot dogs and delicious. Fountain drinks included strawberry pop - so pretty much this is the perfect lunch spot. I think you should visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Detroit Coney Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. On Wednesdays, get 2 coneys and order of fries and a drink for $9.99.

a8ntAz94k8qW6iEHvD3tiA.text: Great place to grab a replica of Detroit. From the Faygo and governors pop, down to the loose burger and coneys dogs.  Have to get back here soon lots of daily specials the stay busy so worth the wait.

A6-Hks6Pr-093gVnnmi3iA.text: Really good food! Lots to choose from!! We got the Detroit coney dog as well as the seasoned fries, HIGHLY RECOMMEND!! The food comes out quick, fresh and hot! Also, really friendly staff!! Check this place out

z4jJHhRELrIhc-L2zhv_Jw.text: Four words.....FLAMIN HOT ONION RINGS!!! This place has lots of unique options when it comes to hot dogs, burgers and fries. Plus they have flamin hot onion rings which my sister ordered when we went & they were to die for!!! So delicious! They have a daily special which is a different combo everyday for on or around $8 & some change. Very budget friendly!!  The owner is extremely friendly. He personally greeted everyone who walked into his restaurant & he had a big smile & his attitude was extremely positive that he made the atmosphere so nice! I would come back just for his friendly demeanor.  The service was very quick & they even offered a discount through yelp!! I recommend this place if you want a taste of a good hot dog or burger or if you want to step out of your zone and be daring with the flamin hot onion rings!! :)) You'll enjoy yourself here.

Gp9-qM5bJIuutcBCkykf-Q.text: I ordered a Classic Cheeseburger. It comes with two patties. Sounds like a lot but the counter guy explained that they are a little smaller so two actually is like one. I kept is simple and had the basic condiments (NO onions!)  The bun makes the burger, and they don't disappoint. Soft, but it held together; perfect. The meat was cooked perfectly, and the double is plenty of meat. If you're a T. Rex you can order multiple patties.  Last time I was there I had the beer battered onion rings, and they were VERY good and cooked just right. This time I tried tater tots w/blue cheese and Frank's RedHot. The blue cheese added a nice bite to the plate, but the tots could have been cooked more. They didn't hold together when "forked." If you order tots there ask that they cook them to firmness :-)  Friendly service, and fast; considering they custom make your order. Plenty of Michigan memorabilia; the guy says they order a lot of authentic foods from Michigan/midwest to keep it real. Bettermade Chips, Faygo pop, Superman Ice Cream . . .  Next time, I'll have a Coney Dog to keep my life as exciting as I can push it! :-)
